result.execSummary:
The defendant Linda Casarez Pettis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
Court will allow for early termination of Probation if Agent deems appropriate.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs are to be paid as Condition of Probation.  DNA sample and surcharge are waived.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with as Agent deems appropriate.

No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No contact with the Target Store listed in the Criminal Complaint.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Linda Casarez Pettis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Prison

Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Linda Casarez Pettis in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.


Court orders the following:
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
STAYED.
  
Term of Probation:  9 Months.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
Court will allow for early termination of probation if agent deems appropriate.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
AODA Assessment and follow through as agent deems appropriate. 
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Target listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Costs: $243 - Forthwith - In Lieu of payment 5 Days Jail Concurrent to the 6 Months - STAYED.
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives.


Defendant to be returned to MSDF - FORTHWITH.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Linda Casarez Pettis in court, in custody (by video conference from MSDF), with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.

Next court date will be for Plea and Sentencing.
Court orders an OTP for the next court date.
Defendant to be produced by:  05/13/16.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
From DOC dated 3/25/16 requesting confirmation of defendant's DOB.
Detainer placed at Milwaukee Secure Detention Or Signed Signature Bond to be returned.
Defendant to have no contact with Target store listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Linda Casarez Pettis in court by video conference from Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Defendant going to a halfway house.  Defendant to be released on August 16, 2016.  Hearing scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Informing defendant that proper paperwork including indigency evaluation must be completed before an attorney can be appointed.
